titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2300) to allow a State to combine certain funds to improve the academic achievement of all its students.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-408, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 138.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2300 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. makes in order the Committee on Education and the Workforce amendment in the nature of a substitute now printed in the bill as an original bill modified by the amendments printed in Part A of H. Rept. 106-408. Makes in order only those amendments printed in Part B of H. Rept. 106-408.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 338.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 201 (Roll no. 529).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/20/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 2300 (allowing a State to combine certain funds for the academic achievement of all its students).
